definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Flowers bloom all over our campus.
Not so much changed. It was still very sweet with dear flowers.
sentences.chinese: 她还并没有多少改变，开满了花朵，显得那样甜美。

sentences.english: Flowers bloom all over the yard.
Childhood memories are full of peach blossom.
sentences.chinese: 童年的记忆是开满桃花的。

sentences.english: The trees were full of sweet-smelling, snowy- white flowers.
sentences.chinese: 树上开满了雪白而芬芳的花朵。

sentences.english: The field is full of cole flower.
It was a green spot , on a hill.
sentences.chinese: 有些地方的山上开满了绿色和金色的花。

sentences.english: The tree was covered with beautiful pink blossom.
sentences.chinese: 这树开满了斑斓的粉红色的花。

sentences.english: There are many pear trees covered in blossom.
sentences.chinese: 那儿那里有良多开满花的梨树。

sentences.english: The girl reached a river with flowers on both banks.
sentences.chinese: 那个女孩到了两岸开满花的河边。

sentences.english: The valley was carpeted with azalea blossoms.
The apple trees are in blossom.
sentences.chinese: 这树开满了美丽的粉红色的花。

sentences.english: What tree is the one in full blossom?
sentences.chinese: 开满花的那棵树叫什么树？

sentences.english: In spring, the trees are always green. And the flowers are usually colourful everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 春天里，树都绿了，到处都开满了颜色鲜艳的花朵。

sentences.english: Provence, a town arrounded by flowers.
sentences.chinese: 普罗旺斯，一个开满花的小镇。

sentences.english: Under the trees to the left of him the ground was misty with bluebells.
sentences.chinese: 左边的树下，密匝匝开满了风信子。

definition: fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
style of folk song popular in Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia/CL:首[shou3]
lit. covering the mountains and the plains (idiom)/fig. as far as the eye can see/covering everything/omnipresent
flourishing blossom/a mass of flowers/luxuriant flowers
covering the whole land/over hills and dales
